verses.kjv: And Jacob called unto his sons, and said, Gather yourselves together, that I may tell you that which shall befall you in the last days.
verses.ct: Jacob summoned his sons and said, "Come together so I can reveal what will happen to you in the days to come."

verses.kjv: Gather yourselves together, and hear, ye sons of Jacob; and hearken unto Israel your father.
verses.ct: "Assemble and listen, sons of Jacob; pay attention to Israel, your father."

verses.kjv: Reuben, thou art my firstborn, my might, and the beginning of my strength, the excellency of dignity, and the excellency of power:
verses.ct: "Reuben, you are my firstborn, my vigor, the first sign of my strength, supreme in dignity and supreme in power."

verses.kjv: Unstable as water, thou shalt not excel; because thou wentest up to thy father’s bed; then defiledst thou it: he went up to my couch.
verses.ct: "Turbulent like water, you will not hold the highest place, because you climbed into your father's bed; you defiled it when you went up onto my couch."

verses.kjv: Simeon and Levi are brethren; instruments of cruelty are in their habitations.
verses.ct: "Simeon and Levi are brothers; weapons of violence fill their dwelling places."

verses.kjv: O my soul, come not thou into their secret; unto their assembly, mine honour, be not thou united: for in their anger they slew a man, and in their selfwill they digged down a wall.
verses.ct: "Let my soul not enter their council; let my honour not join their assembly, for in their rage they killed a man, and on a whim they hamstrung oxen."

verses.kjv: Cursed be their anger, for it was fierce; and their wrath, for it was cruel: I will divide them in Jacob, and scatter them in Israel.
verses.ct: "Cursed be their anger, because it was fierce, and their fury, because it was ruthless. I will divide them throughout Jacob and scatter them across Israel."

verses.kjv: Judah, thou art he whom thy brethren shall praise: thy hand shall be in the neck of thine enemies; thy father’s children shall bow down before thee.
verses.ct: "Judah, your brothers will praise you. Your hand will grip the neck of your enemies, and your father's sons will bow down to you."

verses.kjv: Judah is a lion’s whelp: from the prey, my son, thou art gone up: he stooped down, he couched as a lion, and as an old lion; who shall rouse him up?
verses.ct: "Judah is a young lion. You have risen from the prey, my son. He crouches and lies down like a lion, like an aged lion — who dares disturb him?"

verses.kjv: The sceptre shall not depart from Judah, nor a lawgiver from between his feet, until Shiloh come; and unto him shall the gathering of the people be.
verses.ct: "The sceptre will not leave Judah, nor the ruler's staff from between his feet, until Shiloh comes, and the obedience of the nations belongs to him."

verses.kjv: Binding his foal unto the vine, and his ass’s colt unto the choice vine; he washed his garments in wine, and his clothes in the blood of grapes:
verses.ct: "He ties his donkey to the vine, his donkey's colt to the choicest vine. He washes his garments in wine, his robes in the blood of grapes."

verses.kjv: His eyes shall be red with wine, and his teeth white with milk.
verses.ct: "His eyes will be darker than wine, and his teeth whiter than milk."

verses.kjv: Zebulun shall dwell at the haven of the sea; and he shall be for an haven of ships; and his border shall be unto Zidon.
verses.ct: "Zebulun will settle by the seashore. He will become a harbor for ships, and his territory will extend toward Zidon."

verses.kjv: Issachar is a strong ass couching down between two burdens:
verses.ct: "Issachar is a sturdy donkey lying down between two saddlebags."

verses.kjv: And he saw that rest was good, and the land that it was pleasant; and bowed his shoulder to bear, and became a servant unto tribute.
verses.ct: "When he saw how good the resting place was and how pleasant the land, he bent his back to carry the load and submitted to forced labor."

verses.kjv: Dan shall judge his people, as one of the tribes of Israel.
verses.ct: "Dan will provide justice for his people as one of the tribes of Israel."

verses.kjv: Dan shall be a serpent by the way, an adder in the path, that biteth the horse heels, so that his rider shall fall backward.
verses.ct: "Dan will be a snake beside the road, a viper along the path, that strikes at the horse's heels so that its rider tumbles backward."

verses.kjv: I have waited for thy salvation, O LORD.
verses.ct: "I look to you for salvation, O LORD."

verses.kjv: Gad, a troop shall overcome him: but he shall overcome at the last.
verses.ct: "Gad — raiders will attack him, but he will strike back at their heels."

verses.kjv: Out of Asher his bread shall be fat, and he shall yield royal dainties.
verses.ct: "Asher's food will be rich, and he will produce delicacies fit for a king."

verses.kjv: Naphtali is a hind let loose: he giveth goodly words.
verses.ct: "Naphtali is a doe set free; he speaks beautiful words."

verses.kjv: Joseph is a fruitful bough, even a fruitful bough by a well; whose branches run over the wall:
verses.ct: "Joseph is a fruitful vine, a fruitful vine beside a spring, whose branches climb over the wall."

verses.kjv: The archers have sorely grieved him, and shot at him, and hated him:
verses.ct: "Archers attacked him bitterly, shooting at him and harassing him with hostility."

verses.kjv: But his bow abode in strength, and the arms of his hands were made strong by the hands of the mighty God of Jacob; (from thence is the shepherd, the stone of Israel:)
verses.ct: "Yet his bow remained steady, and his arms were made strong by the hands of the Mighty One of Jacob — from there comes the shepherd, the stone of Israel —"

verses.kjv: Even by the God of thy father, who shall help thee; and by the Almighty, who shall bless thee with blessings of heaven above, blessings of the deep that lieth under, blessings of the breasts, and of the womb:
verses.ct: "by the God of your father, who will help you, and by the Almighty, who will bless you with blessings from the heavens above, blessings from the deep that lies beneath, blessings of the breasts and of the womb."

verses.kjv: The blessings of thy father have prevailed above the blessings of my progenitors unto the utmost bound of the everlasting hills: they shall be on the head of Joseph, and on the crown of the head of him that was separate from his brethren.
verses.ct: "The blessings of your father have surpassed the blessings of my ancestors, reaching to the farthest limits of the eternal hills. May they rest on the head of Joseph, on the brow of the one set apart from his brothers."

verses.kjv: Benjamin shall ravin as a wolf: in the morning he shall devour the prey, and at night he shall divide the spoil.
verses.ct: "Benjamin is a ravenous wolf. At dawn he devours the prey, and in the evening he divides the plunder."

verses.kjv: All these are the twelve tribes of Israel: and this is it that their father spake unto them, and blessed them; every one according to his blessing he blessed them.
verses.ct: These are the twelve tribes of Israel, and this is what their father spoke over them. He blessed each one with the blessing suited to him.

verses.kjv: And he charged them, and said unto them, I am to be gathered unto my people: bury me with my fathers in the cave that is in the field of Ephron the Hittite,
verses.ct: Then he gave them instructions, saying, "I am about to join my ancestors. Bury me alongside my fathers in the cave in the field of Ephron the Hittite,"

verses.kjv: In the cave that is in the field of Machpelah, which is before Mamre, in the land of Canaan, which Abraham bought with the field of Ephron the Hittite for a possession of a buryingplace.
verses.ct: "the cave in the field of Machpelah, east of Mamre, in the land of Canaan — the field that Abraham purchased from Ephron the Hittite as a burial site."

verses.kjv: There they buried Abraham and Sarah his wife; there they buried Isaac and Rebekah his wife; and there I buried Leah.
verses.ct: "Abraham and his wife Sarah were buried there. Isaac and his wife Rebekah were buried there. That is also where I buried Leah."

verses.kjv: The purchase of the field and of the cave that is therein was from the children of Heth.
verses.ct: "The field and the cave within it were bought from the children of Heth."

verses.kjv: And when Jacob had made an end of commanding his sons, he gathered up his feet into the bed, and yielded up the ghost, and was gathered unto his people.
verses.ct: After Jacob finished giving these instructions to his sons, he drew his feet up into the bed, breathed his last, and was joined to his people.
